# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree No. 71 of 2025
### Appointing a Member from the Industrial Sector
### to the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

- After reviewing the Constitution,
- And on the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And on Law No. 56 of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, and its amending laws,
- And on Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Succession and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:
### Article One
Mr. / Faisal Abdulaziz Faisal Al-Zain <orig>فيصل عبد العزيز فيصل الزين</orig> is appointed as a member of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> - representing the industrial sector - for a renewable term of three years.

### Article Two
The Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall implement this Decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Dhahi Al-Ajeel Al-Askar <orig>خليفة عبد الله ضاحي العجيل العسكر</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 24 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 22 April 2025 AD

# Decree No. 72 of 2025
## Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Nationality from Certain Individuals

- After reviewing the Constitution,
- And on the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And on Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And on Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Succession and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:
### Article One

# Cabinet Resolution <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## No. 411 of 2025
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificates
### From Certain Individuals
The Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Article (21 bis "A") of Amiri Decree <orig>المرسوم الأميري</orig> No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree <orig>المرسوم</orig> No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the recommendation of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
Has decided:
### Article One
The Kuwaiti citizenship certificate shall be withdrawn from those mentioned below, and Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from anyone who acquired it through dependency on the holder of that certificate:
1. Rifai Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>رفاعي خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
2. Kamal Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>كمال خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
3. Rashid Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>رشيد خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
4. Bardan Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>بردان خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
5. Matloub Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>مطلوب خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
6. Saeed Mohammed Hadi Dhaiban Al-Ajmi <orig>سعيد محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.
7. Masoud Mohammed Hadi Dhaiban Al-Ajmi <orig>مسعود محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.
8. Hadi Mohammed Hadi Dhaiban Al-Ajmi <orig>هادي محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.
9. Mohammed Awad Jabran Mohammed Al-Ajmi <orig>محمد عوض جبران محمد العجمي</orig>.
10. Muthakkar Manahi Ayed Shtran Al-Ajmi <orig>مذكر مناحي عايض شتران العجمي</orig>.
11. Mubarak Manahi Ayed Shtran Al-Ajmi <orig>مبارك مناحي عايض شتران العجمي</orig>.
12. Ahmed Gholoum Haji Hassan <orig>أحمد غلوم حاجي حسن</orig>.
### Article Two
The Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>
Issued on: 22 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 20 April 2025 AD

Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
In the Name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait <orig>أمير دولة الكويت</orig>
Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The Supreme Wisdom <orig>الحكمة الكلية</orig>
Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>

## Decision

On Thursday, 2025/4/10, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>,
With the membership of Professor / Zaid Abdul Hadi Al-Attar <orig>زيد عبد الهادي العطار</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>,
And in the presence of Professor / Khalid Abdullah Al-Qaisi <orig>خالد عبدالله القيسي</orig>, Secretary,
Regarding Application No.: (23/2024 Bankruptcy Month <orig>شهر إفلاس</orig>)
Registered under Automated Number: 240825520
Submitted by: Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
Against: Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig>
After reviewing the documents and the Secretary's <orig>الأمين</orig> letter dated 2025/4/6 requesting the issuance of a decision authorizing him to extract bank statements for Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig> for the period from 2025/1/1 until the present date, and in accordance with the provisions of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig>.
The facts are summarized in the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision issued on 2025/3/16 regarding the Secretary's <orig>الأمين</orig> right to carry out his scope of work in financial and criminal investigation, undertake necessary financial and in-kind settlements, issue arrest warrants and financial and legal prosecution orders, and file lawsuits as referred to in his letter dated 2025/2/16, which was referenced to avoid repetition.
Whereas Article 1 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> stipulates that "Precautionary Measures <orig>التدابير التحفظية</orig>: Procedures taken by the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> or the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> in accordance with the provisions of this Law <orig>هذا القانون</orig> with the aim of preserving and managing the debtor's <orig>المدين</orig> assets or the bankruptcy estate <orig>أموال التفليسة</orig> and preventing their concealment, including placing seals on the debtor's <orig>المدين</orig> place of business, appointing a temporary trustee <orig>أمين مؤقت</orig> to manage his assets, imposing restrictions on the debtor <orig>المدين</orig> or any related party <orig>طرف ذو علاقة</orig> in disposing of his assets, or preventing him and any of his board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس إدارته</orig>, or managers <orig>مدراءه</orig>, or board members or managers of any company related to the debtor <orig>المدين</orig>, from traveling for a certain period or until a certain event occurs." And Article (9) of the same Law <orig>القانون</orig> stipulates that "The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall be responsible for the following: 1 - 2 - 3 - 4- Issuing all decisions within the jurisdiction of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> under this Law <orig>هذا القانون</orig>, notifying concerned parties <orig>ذوي الشأن</orig> thereof, announcing them, and publishing them.
5- Monitoring the debtor's <orig>المدين</orig> assets and operations, expediting procedures, and taking necessary measures as specified in this Law <orig>هذا القانون</orig>...". And Article (32) stipulates that "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, upon a request submitted to him by the regulatory authority <orig>الجهة الرقابية</orig> or any interested party <orig>طرف ذو مصلحة</orig>, may decide to take any precautionary measures <orig>التدابير التحفظية</orig>, including placing seals on the debtor's <orig>المدين</orig> place of business, appointing a temporary trustee <orig>أمين مؤقت</orig> to manage his assets, imposing restrictions on him in disposing of his assets, or preventing him and any of his board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس إدارته</orig> or managers <orig>مدراءه</orig> from traveling for a certain period or until a certain event occurs. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, upon a request submitted to him by the debtor <orig>المدين</orig>, may issue his decision to suspend claims." And Article (1/52) stipulates that "The inspector <orig>المفتش</orig>, in order to carry out the assigned task, may request the testimony of any person without administering an oath, and may also request any information or documents from the debtor <orig>المدين</orig> or a creditor <orig>أحد الدائنين</orig> or units subject to the Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig> or persons licensed by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> or regulatory bodies <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> or any governmental or non-governmental entity."
Based on the foregoing, and since the Secretary <orig>الأمين</orig> requested the issuance of a decision authorizing him to extract the bank statements of Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig> from Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>, Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig>, and Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig> so that he can complete his scope of work and finalize the financial and criminal investigation procedures and issue the necessary arrest and prosecution orders, and since granting the Secretary's <orig>الأمين</orig> request serves the interest of the creditors <orig>الدائنين</orig> and the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig>, we therefore decide to issue the decision authorizing him to extract the company's bank statements from the aforementioned banks for the period stated.

Therefore, we have decided the following:
To authorize the Secretary <orig>الأمين</orig> to extract the following bank statements of Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig>:
1- Account No. (96237683) at Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig>
2- Account No. (0114334002) at Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig>
3- The company's accounts at Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>.
This is for the period from 2025/1/1 until the present date, and the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall provide the Secretary <orig>الأمين</orig> with a certified true copy of this decision and legally notify the concerned parties <orig>ذوي الشأن</orig> thereof.

And upon Ministerial Resolution No. 1976/81 regarding the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its amendments.
And upon the letter from the Assistant Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد</orig> for Traffic and Operations Affairs No. 79129 dated 2025/3/11 and its attachments.
And based on the presentation of the Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.

Decided

### Article (1)

Article (211 bis) of the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. 1976/81 shall be amended to read as follows:
The reconciliation amount with the accused in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed, in implementation of the provision of Clause (7) of Article (41) of Decree-Law No. 2025/5 regarding some provisions of Decree-Law No. 1976/67 concerning Traffic, shall be according to the following principles:

1.  A sum of seventy Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> shall be paid in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed by no more than twenty kilometers.
2.  A sum of eighty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> shall be paid in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed by more than twenty kilometers up to thirty kilometers.
3.  A sum of ninety Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> shall be paid in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed by more than thirty kilometers up to forty kilometers.
4.  A sum of one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> shall be paid in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed by more than forty kilometers up to fifty kilometers.
5.  A sum of one hundred and twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> shall be paid in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed by more than fifty kilometers up to sixty kilometers.
6.  A sum of one hundred and thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> shall be paid in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed by more than sixty kilometers up to seventy kilometers.
7.  A sum of one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> shall be paid in case of exceeding the prescribed maximum speed by more than seventy kilometers.

### Article (2)

The Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> shall implement this resolution, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

provided that, in addition to the licensee, one or more practitioners as stipulated in the workforce clause of this decision shall work in this complex.
3- A license to open a complex for providing psychological consultations shall be granted to a Kuwaiti company whose objectives include the establishment, operation, and management of a facility for providing psychological consultations, provided that it employs a licensed psychologist with at least a first-level practitioner degree in psychotherapy (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig> decisions), holding a doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, and fully dedicated to working in the psychological consultation complex, in addition to one or more practitioners as stipulated in the workforce clause of this decision.
harmful, maladaptive, or undesirable, and promoting personal relationships and guidance in various aspects of life for self-development, improving work, social, and family relationships, increasing quality of life, enhancing personal effectiveness, and improving mental health.
The scope of practicing psychotherapy and psychological and social consultations includes all of the following:
a- Diagnosis and treatment of psychological problems related to thoughts, feelings, and behavior, as well as psychological symptoms of physical illness, physical injury, or disability.
b- Providing non-pharmacological psychotherapy accompanying the treatment of alcohol addiction, dependence disorders, and drug abuse problems.
c- Applying psychological scales and assessments, intelligence and personality tests, cognitive abilities, interests, attitudes, and professional and academic aptitudes.
d- Education and awareness related to topics of psychological assessment, therapy and consultations, and managing and improving academic and work environments.
e- Providing psychological counseling, psychotherapy, psychoanalysis, cognitive behavioral therapy, positive therapy, acceptance and mindfulness therapy, dialectical behavioral therapy, marital and family counseling, applied behavior analysis, or any non-pharmacological therapeutic practices falling under therapy or psychological consultations.
f- Measuring neurocognitive abilities, developing and implementing clinical neuropsychological treatment and rehabilitation programs, measurement using biofeedback or neurofeedback devices, and using electroencephalography (EEG) devices.
3- Psychological Consultation Unit: This is a place where psychological consultations are provided by a licensed Kuwaiti psychologist working alone without the presence of other practitioners, within independent spaces.
4- Psychological Consultation Complex: This is a place where psychological consultations are provided by one or more psychologists in addition to one or more practitioners as stipulated in the workforce clause, provided that the complex is within independent, interconnected spaces or on successive floors.
Third: Conditions for Granting a License for a Psychological Consultation Unit or Complex:
1- A license to open a psychological consultation unit shall be granted to a licensed Kuwaiti psychologist with at least a first-level practitioner degree in psychotherapy (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig> decisions), holding a doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, provided that they work alone in the unit without the presence of other psychologists or practitioners.
2- A license to open a psychological consultation complex shall be granted to one or more licensed Kuwaiti psychologists with at least a first-level practitioner degree in psychotherapy (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig> decisions),

provided that they hold at least a Master's degree or a Higher Diploma and have practical experience and clinical training according to the requirements stipulated in this decision. 2- Psychological Researcher <orig>باحث نفسي</orig>: A psychology specialist who conducts clinical or counseling interviews, and whose work is limited to collecting information and performing appropriate psychological assessments for cases as requested by and under the supervision of a licensed psychotherapist. Provided that they hold a Bachelor's degree in Psychology according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, and at the level of Psychological Researcher <orig>باحث نفسي</orig> at least (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.
3- Applied Behavioral Analyst (ABA): A specialist in understanding, analyzing, and identifying the causes of disordered behavior, who develops and implements an educational program for behavior modification, especially for persons with disabilities, through the application of applied learning techniques. Provided that they hold a Bachelor's degree in Psychology and a professional certificate in Applied Behavior Analysis accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>. And at a level equivalent to a Psychotherapist Practitioner <orig>ممارس علاج نفسي</orig> at least (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.
4- Applied Behavioral Technician: A specialist in applying an educational program for behavior modification, especially for persons with disabilities, through the application of applied learning techniques. Provided that they hold a Diploma in Applied Behavior Analysis accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>. And at a level equivalent to a Therapy Technician <orig>فني علاج</orig> at least (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.
5- Occupational Therapist (Occupational Therapy Specialist) <orig>اخصائي علاج بالعمل (علاج وظيفي)</orig>: A specialist in rehabilitation for cases suffering from difficulties in performing daily life tasks or work. They provide therapeutic interventions to enable children with disabilities to actively participate in academic and social life. They assist patients in recovering from injury to regain their skills. They provide support to the elderly who suffer from impaired physical or cognitive abilities. They must hold at least a Bachelor's degree in Occupational Therapy, and be at the level of Occupational Therapy Practitioner <orig>ممارس علاج بالعمل</orig> at least (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.
6- Speech and Hearing Specialist <orig>اخصائي السمع والنطق</orig>: A specialist in providing therapy to individuals suffering from disorders in hearing, communication, and spoken and written language. They must hold at least a Bachelor's degree in Speech and Hearing Therapy at the level of Speech and Hearing Practitioner <orig>ممارس نطق وسمع</orig> at least (according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.
7- Any other relevant health specializations in psychotherapy after obtaining the approval of the Psychiatry Department <orig>قسم الطب النفسي</orig> in the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
8- Director of the Psychological Complex <orig>مدير المجمع النفسي</orig>: If the licensee of the Psychological Complex <orig>صاحب ترخيص المجمع النفسي</orig> does not wish to be its Medical Director <orig>مديراً طبياً</orig>, they must appoint a Medical Director <orig>مديراً طبياً</orig> who will be technically responsible for it and effectively supervise the management of its operations, in accordance with the following controls:
    a- Must be a psychotherapist at the level of Senior Psychotherapist Practitioner <orig>ممارس أول علاج نفسي</orig> at least and hold a Doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, provided that they are fully dedicated to working in the Psychological Complex <orig>المجمع النفسي</orig>.
    b- Must not have been previously convicted in cases involving breach of honor and trust <orig>قضايا مخلة بالشرف والأمانة</orig>.
    c- Their period of residence in the State must not be less than 9 months each year.
    d- Must not be a Medical Director <orig>مديراً طبياً</orig> of any health facility or any of its branches.
    e- Must have experience in the field of management or the activity of the Complex.
    f- Obtain prior approval from the Ministry.
    g- A Deputy Director <orig>نائباً للمدير</orig> may be appointed to assist in performing their duties, and in the absence of the Medical Director <orig>المدير الطبي</orig>, a deputy must be assigned, provided that the same conditions apply to them.
Fifth: Requirements for Obtaining a Psychotherapist License <orig>ترخيص معالج نفسي</orig>:
General Conditions:
An applicant seeking to obtain a license as a psychotherapist to work in the private sector <orig>القطاع الأهلي</orig> in the State of Kuwait must meet the following:
1- Must hold at least a Master's degree or a Higher Diploma in Psychology or its equivalent, and have completed the academic requirements from educational institutions accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait, with submission of proof of the request for academic equivalency of the scientific certificate from the accredited authorities in the State, and according to the requirements stipulated in this decision.
2- Must have "practical experience" in a health facility or a psychotherapy or psychological counseling facility, and "supervised clinical training."
Academic Requirements for Psychotherapists Holding a Doctorate:
Obtaining a Doctorate or its equivalent in the field of Psychology, Clinical Psychology, Psychotherapy, Psychological Counseling, Child Life Care, Clinical Social Work program, or a General Doctorate program in Psychology, provided that the academic outcome meets the following:
1- The study program must be an integrated and structured sequence of study within a college or university accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait,

### Practical Experience and Clinical Training for Psychotherapists Holding a Doctorate, Master's, or Higher Diploma
A psychotherapist must have "practical experience" and "supervised clinical training" as follows:
1- Must have practical experience of no less than 6 years after obtaining the university qualification (Bachelor's degree), which is equivalent to at least the title of Senior Psychotherapy Practitioner <orig>ممارس أول علاج نفسي</orig> according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>. The duration may be continuous or intermittent, provided it is in the field of psychotherapy from within or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and practical training or residency (Internship) years during the postgraduate stage are counted within the practical experience years.
2- The practical experience must include "supervised clinical training" for no less than 1000 therapy sessions (session duration 45-60 minutes), conducted face-to-face with cases and supervised by a supervisor holding a doctorate degree and a license in psychotherapy, provided that 25% of these therapy sessions are under direct supervision from the supervisor. Direct supervised clinical training hours during the postgraduate stage are counted as part of the therapy sessions, provided that the number of hours is clearly stated in the academic transcript and mentioned in the course description.
3- The "supervised clinical training" must be conducted in a licensed psychiatric or psychological counseling health facility, or in an entity concerned with education and training in psychotherapy. All reports and case data proving these therapy sessions must be submitted while maintaining the confidentiality of this data, provided that the reports include comments, guidance, supervisor's evaluation, and approval.
4- The supervisor may be a psychiatrist, provided they have experience in psychotherapy and hold at least the rank of Senior Specialist <orig>اختصاصي أول</orig>, and work at a university, an institute for medical specialties, or a governmental higher academic institution, provided that
2- The study period for obtaining the doctorate must not be less than 3 full-time academic years, or their equivalent in part-time study,
3- The program must be specialized in Clinical Psychotherapy or Counseling Psychology (PhD in Clinical Psychology or PhD in Counseling Psychology) or a professional doctorate program in Clinical or Counseling Psychology (PsyD or DCounsPsy or DClinPsy) or a general doctorate program in the field of Psychology or Educational Psychology (PhD in Psychology or Doctor of Philosophy in Psychology) or any closely related doctorate program in therapy or counseling psychology such as a clinical social work program, childhood studies, or child life, provided that all the aforementioned programs meet the requirements stated in this clause,
4- The doctoral study system must be based on courses and credit hours, include examinations and evaluation, and be indicated in the academic transcript as actual study within the educational institution through direct instruction with faculty members and with multiple students in the program, with actual presence in the country of study for a period of no less than 75% of the study duration. These courses must include specialized studies in the field of psychology,
5- The applicant must have completed at least 17 different academic courses in the field of psychological diagnosis and therapy during the Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctorate programs, as detailed in the guiding appendix for approved courses in the field of psychological diagnosis and therapy attached to this decision. It is permissible for a course to be repeated (i.e., the same content) provided it is at a different academic level. Courses that teach other areas of psychology not related to psychological diagnosis and therapy are not considered.
6- Any academic courses in the field of psychotherapy completed through an affiliation system (without being registered within an academic program) may be counted towards fulfilling the requirement of studying academic courses in the field of psychotherapy, provided that the educational institution is recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

### Academic Requirements for Psychotherapists Holding a Master's or Higher Diploma
The applicant must hold a Master's degree or Higher Diploma or their equivalent in any of the fields of psychology, educational psychology, child life care, or social work, provided that the following academic outcomes are met:
1- The study program must be an integrated and regular sequence of study within a college or university accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>,
2- The study system must be based on courses and credit hours, include examinations and evaluation, and be indicated in the academic transcript as actual study within the educational institution and through direct instruction

2- In the case of clinical psychotherapy, the clinical interview must be based on building a professional relationship between the therapist and the client, collecting clinical information, and applying appropriate psychological scales for the client's condition, in order to formulate the diagnosis or differential diagnosis, and then develop the treatment plan. When providing services to children, sufficient training for dealing with them must be available. Diagnosis is made by the psychological therapist and is expected to be in accordance with a scientifically proven diagnostic system such as (ICD-11) or (DSM-5TR), while following any updated editions.
3- In the case of psychological counseling, the counseling interview must be based on building a professional relationship between the therapist and the client, collecting information, and applying appropriate psychological scales for the client's condition, and then developing the counseling plan.
4- The necessity of accurate documentation of all diagnostic and therapeutic processes practiced in the unit or complex, along with the necessity of writing a comprehensive initial assessment for each client and keeping it in their file. If there is a need to record the therapy session for documentation within the therapist's training hours or for educational purposes, written consent from the patient must be obtained.
5- It is strictly prohibited for personnel in the psychotherapy unit or complex to direct clients to use any medicinal treatments, supplements, or dietary regimens. Should the matter necessitate it, they must be referred to a specialized and licensed practitioner by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to provide these medications, nutritional supplements, health products, special foods, or herbal preparations.
6- The practice of any non-invasive therapeutic intervention, such as electrical, magnetic, or ultrasound brain stimulation devices, or any other similar devices, is prohibited unless a permit for their use in the unit or complex has been obtained from the competent authority.
7- The scope of practice for psychological therapists is limited to working under the supervision of a psychological therapist holding a Doctorate degree.
Psychological therapists holding a Doctorate degree, in addition to performing all tasks of psychological therapists who do not hold a Master's degree or Higher Diploma, shall also:
1- Supervise therapists working in the facility, if any.
2- Provide supervision services for therapy sessions required to meet the supervised clinical experience requirements for psychological therapists.
3- Approve psychological reports and tests, and write and approve session summaries, provided that reports are free of recommendations. Upon request from the client or their legal representative, the summary must be free of any recommendations with legal or Sharia effect. If any recommendations are requested by the client or their legal representative, they must be referred to the Kuwait Center for Mental Health <orig>مركز الكويت للصحة النفسية</orig> affiliated with the Ministry for writing these recommendations.
Sixth: General Provisions:
1- Psychotherapy offices and psychological consulting companies or psychological and social consulting companies with valid licenses from the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig> are granted a one-year grace period starting from the date of issuance of this decision to regularize their status and fulfill the requirements contained herein.
must be accredited by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي</orig> of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
5- Faculty members holding a Doctorate degree in one of the fields of psychology or educational psychology who work in a government university, or any higher academic institution accredited by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي</orig> of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, are exempted from the requirement of practical experience in the field of psychotherapy or the requirement of fulfilling the number of course credits they passed during their studies, provided that they have practical experience in teaching for no less than (5) years or scientific research in one of the courses mentioned in the Guidance Appendix for Approved Courses in the field of psychotherapy. They must also fulfill the requirements for therapy sessions mentioned in this clause under "Supervised Clinical Experience."
Academic Requirements for Psychological Researchers Holding a Bachelor's Degree
Obtaining a Bachelor's degree in any of the fields of psychology, educational psychology, or child life care, provided that the academic outcome meets the following:
1- The study program must be an integrated and organized sequence of study within an accredited college or university by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
2- The study system must be based on a course and credit hour system and include exams and evaluation, as indicated in the academic transcript. The study must be actual within the educational institution and through direct instruction with faculty members and the presence of multiple students in the program, with actual presence in the country of study for a period of no less than 75% of the study duration. These courses must include specialized studies in the field of psychology.
Practical Experience and Clinical Training for Psychological Researchers Holding a Bachelor's Degree
1- Must have practical experience of no less than two years after obtaining the university qualification (Bachelor's degree), equivalent to at least the title of psychological researcher or psychotherapy practitioner. The period may be continuous or intermittent, provided it is in the field of psychology from within or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
Sixth: Job Description:
Psychological Researcher Holding a Bachelor's Degree
1- Their work is limited to providing the initial clinical interview or initial counseling interview (Initial assessment), which includes collecting information and applying appropriate psychological scales for the client's condition as requested and under the supervision of the licensed psychological therapist. When providing services to children, sufficient training for dealing with them must be available.
2- The necessity of accurate documentation of all information and results of tests and psychological scales performed in the unit or complex.
Psychological Therapist Holding a Master's Degree or Higher Diploma
1- Allowed to receive psychological cases that can be treated as outpatient cases. However, cases requiring medical interventions or hospitalization must be referred to the specialized doctor or hospital. This also applies to cases suffering from acute symptoms that pose a danger to the patient themselves or others, such as acute symptoms of substance abuse, active suicidal ideation, or severe agitation. The psychological therapist must emphasize to the patient or their family the necessity of visiting the hospital to receive treatment, along with the necessity of providing a record

Guidance Appendix for Courses in the Field of Psychotherapy:
Courses or study topics that are studied under the semester system (courses). The semester system refers to a study term of approximately 4 months during the spring or autumn semester, and approximately two months during the summer semester, or their equivalent in the annual system. This must include tests and evaluation, and be recorded in an academic Transcript. The study must be actual, conducted within the educational institution, through direct instruction with faculty members, and with multiple students in the program. The course content must include the following topics:

## Psychiatry
### Core Courses in Therapy
- Clinical Psychology
- Psychotherapy
- Psychopharmacology
- Ethical and Professional Issues in Clinical Practice
- Evidence-based Interventions.
- Theories in Clinical Psychology
- Group Psychotherapy
- Addiction psychotherapy
- Techniques of Psychotherapy
- Time-Effective Treatment

## Counseling psychology
### Core Courses in Counseling
- Counseling theories
- Group Counseling
- Career counseling
- Multicultural counseling
- Marriage and Family Counseling
- Addiction counseling
- School psychology or counseling
- Counseling for Children and adolescents
- Psychology of Stress
- Stress and Trauma

## Cognitive assessments
### Courses in Psychological Testing and Measurement
- Personality assessments
- Clinical assessments

## Psychoanalytic or Psychodynamic Theory
### Courses in Psychotherapy Methods
- Psychoanalytic Practice
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy CBT Theories and Practice
- Dialectic Behavior Therapy DBT Theories and Practice
- Mindfulness Therapy

## Social Work with Individuals
### Courses in Clinical Psychological Services
- Social Work with Families
- Group work.
- Group work dynamics
- Family Therapy
- Clinical Practice with Couples
- Anti-Oppressive Practice in Families and Communities
- Theories and Practice with specific populations (LGBT, Children, Adults, Older Adults..etc)

## Neuropsychology
### Core Courses in Psychology
- Cognitive Neuroscience
- Biological Psychology
- Physiological Psychology
- Affective Neuroscience
- Psychology of Individuals with Special Needs
- Lifespan Psychopathology
- Health Psychology
- Systems and History of Psychology or Clinical Psychology
- Diversity Issues in Psychology or Clinical Psychology
- Personality Psychology or Clinical Personality Psychology
- Developmental Psychology or Child Clinical Psychology
- Professional Orientation or Clinical Professional Orientation

## Psychopathology
### Core Courses in Diagnosis
- Abnormal Psychology
- Mental disorder diagnosis
- Clinical Interview

### Other Courses
- Any course shows evidence that its content is related to psychotherapy.

# Decision No. (73 / 2025)
## Regarding the Regulation of Work between the Internet and Communications Gateway of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority and Local Telecommunications and Internet Networks

The Chairman of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>:
- Having reviewed Law No. (37) of 2014, establishing the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>هيئة تنظيم الاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> and its amendments,
- And Decree No. (43) of 2025, regarding the termination of work with Decree No. (144) of 2022, concerning the formation of the Authority's Board of Directors,
- And the Esteemed Council of Ministers' Decision No. (993) of 2015, issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (37) of 2014, establishing the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>هيئة تنظيم الاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> and its amendments,
- And the Decision of the Minister of State for Communications Affairs No. (18) of 2025 issued on 2025/3/18,
- And the letter from His Excellency the Minister of State for Communications Affairs No. 27 dated 2025/1/8 regarding the request for approval of the special decision between the Authority's Internet and Communications Gateway and local telecommunications networks,
- And the Decision of the Authority's Board of Directors No. (1/2025) taken at its meeting No. (377) held on 2025/1/22, approving the draft decision regarding the regulation of work between the Authority's Internet and Communications Gateway and local telecommunications networks,
- And based on the exigencies of work.
Has decided:
### Article One
#### Definitions
*   **The Authority**: The Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>.
*   **The Internet and Communications Gateway of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>بوابة الانترنت والاتصالات التابعة للهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>**: The communications and information technology systems of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> that enable it to connect local and international telecommunications and internet networks. This includes internet network systems and wireless communication networks with the aim of regulating and supervising the telecommunications sector.
*   **Telecommunications and Internet Company Networks**: The internet communication systems used locally in the networks of telecommunications and internet companies licensed as local telecommunications and internet service providers, and licensed to manage, establish, or operate a telecommunications network or internet service to provide communication services to the public. This includes information or content providers whose services are provided via telecommunications and information technology networks. It defines the communication data traffic of any person party to a contract with a telecommunications operator.
# Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>

Decided
### Article One
The following terms – wherever they appear in this Resolution – shall have the meanings indicated opposite each of them:
- Existing Capacities: The total registered capacity subscriptions for each service provider at the time of issuance of this Resolution.
- Additional Capacities: Capacities allocated to the service provider in excess of the existing capacities.
### Article Two
Resolution No. (17) of 2021 of the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Authority regarding the tariff for International Private Leased Circuits (IPLC) for internet services via international submarine and terrestrial cables and the interconnection tariff shall remain in effect for calculating existing capacity subscriptions.
### Article Three
The tariff for the rental value of additional capacity subscriptions shall be:
Firstly: For International Private Leased Circuits (IPLC) for internet services
For 10G STM64 capacity if there is a desire to commit for one year
general for obtaining telecommunications and internet services.
### Article Two
All telecommunications companies and those licensed to manage, establish, or operate a telecommunications network, or internet service to provide communications to the public and information or content providers, must connect the network they use to the Internet and Communications Gateway of the Public Authority for Communications and Information Technology <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> in accordance with the privacy protection standards determined by the Authority.
### Article Three
The Authority, through the connection of the Internet and Communications Gateway of the Public Authority for Communications and Information Technology <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> and the networks of telecommunications or internet companies, shall undertake to enhance the security protection of telecommunications and internet networks, ensure the application of the provisions stipulated in relevant laws, regulations, and resolutions, guarantee the implementation of security policies for telecommunications, information technology, and internet networks, and activate their safe use by ensuring the application of guidelines and rules established by the Authority. Through this, it can regulate and supervise the telecommunications sector with the aim of improving it and providing protection for users' interests, and ensure that these licensed companies take all necessary technical measures to block any materials, websites, programs, or other content that violate the laws in force in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and anything that affects public order and public morals. This is in accordance with the provisions of Article 3, paragraphs (c) and (sh) of Law No. 37 of 2014, referred to.
### Article Four
Telecommunications and internet companies are obligated, when connecting their network gateway to the Internet and Communications Gateway of the Public Authority for Communications and Information Technology <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>, to adhere to all specifications, standards, and procedures set by the Authority in this regard, pursuant to Law No. 37 of 2014, referred to, and its executive regulations, and all laws in force in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
### Article Five
Without prejudice to the legally prescribed penalties, the Authority has the right, in the event of a proven violation of the provisions of this Resolution, to take the measures stipulated in Article 64 of Law No. 37 of 2014, referred to.
### Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its jurisdiction, from the date of its issuance, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Resolution No. (75 / 2025)
## Regarding the Tariff for Leased International Private Leased Circuits (IPLC) for Internet Services via International Submarine and Terrestrial Cables and Interconnection Tariff – Long-Term Commitments

**Chairman of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>:**

- Upon review of Law No. (37) of 2014, regarding the establishment of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>هيئة تنظيم الاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> and its amendments,
- And Decree No. (1) of 2025, regarding fees and financial costs for the utilization of public facilities and services,
- And Decree No. (43) of 2025, regarding the termination of work with Decree No. (144) of 2022, concerning the formation of the Authority's Board of Directors,
- And the esteemed Council of Ministers' Resolution No. (993) of 2015, issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (37) of 2014, regarding the establishment of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>هيئة تنظيم الاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> and its amendments,
- And the esteemed Council of Ministers' Resolution No. (377) adopted at its meeting No. (47) – (12/2025) held on 26/3/2025, regarding the project to stimulate demand for capacities,
- And the Minister of State for Communications Affairs' Resolution No. (18) of 2025 issued on 18/3/2025,
- And the approval of the Authority's Board of Directors at its meeting No. (11) of 2024 on 10/10/2024,
- And the Chairman of the Authority's Board of Directors' Resolution No. (17) of 2021 issued on 25/1/2021,
- And based on the exigencies of work.

**Has Decided**

### Article One

The tariff for the rental value of long-term commitments shall be:
First: For International Private Leased Circuits (IPLC) for Internet services with a capacity of (10G), in case of a desire to commit for a period of (15) years with the rental value tariff paid as a single upfront payment, it shall be (Two Million, Six Hundred Thirty-Five Thousand, Six Hundred Twenty-Seven Dinars and Six Hundred Ten Fils) KWD 2,635,627.610.
Second: For Interconnection Circuits – with a capacity of (10G) STM64, in case of a desire to commit for a period of (15) years with the rental value tariff paid as a single upfront payment, it shall be (Two Million, One Hundred Ninety-Six Thousand, Three Hundred Fifty-Six Dinars and Three Hundred Forty Fils) KWD 2,196,356.340.

### Article Two

Resolution No. (17) of 2021 of the Chairman of the Authority's Board of Directors regarding the tariff for leased circuits (IPLC) for Internet services via international submarine and terrestrial cables and interconnection tariff shall remain in effect.

### Article Three

The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its respective jurisdiction. It shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into force from the date of its issuance. Anything that contradicts or conflicts with the provisions of this Resolution shall be repealed.

one with the rental value tariff paid as a single upfront payment, it shall be (One Hundred Thirty Thousand, Eight Hundred Forty-Eight Dinars) KWD 133,848.
Second: For Interconnection Circuits – with a capacity of (10G) STM64, in case of a desire to commit for a period of one year with the rental value tariff paid as a single upfront payment, it shall be (One Hundred Eleven Thousand, Five Hundred Forty Dinars) KWD 111,540.

### Article Four

First: The tariff specified in Article Three of this Resolution shall apply in accordance with the provisions of this Resolution and shall be effective for a period of three months from the date of its issuance.
Second: The tariff mentioned in Article Three of this Resolution shall apply to additional subscriptions, not existing ones.
Third: The tariff mentioned in Article Three of this Resolution is available on condition of continuous renewal and non-cancellation of any existing capacity subscription for International Private Leased Circuits (IPLC) for Internet services or interconnection circuits from the date of issuance of this Resolution.
Fourth: The continued application of the tariff for leased circuits (IPLC) for Internet services via international submarine and terrestrial cables and interconnection tariff for existing capacity subscriptions at the time of issuance of this Resolution shall be in accordance with Resolution No. (17) of 2021.
Fifth: The provisions of this Resolution shall apply on condition that the additional capacity subscriptions, as per the tariff mentioned in Article Three of this Resolution, are used for sale to end-users, whether individuals or companies (retail sale) – and it is prohibited to sell them to companies holding an Internet service provider or presenter license in accordance with Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig> Resolution No. (657) of 2012 and the Law of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>, and the regulations and resolutions issued in this regard.

### Article Five

The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its respective jurisdiction. It shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into force from the date of its issuance. Anything that contradicts or conflicts with the provisions of this Resolution shall be repealed.

## Ministerial Decision No. (2) of 2025
### Regarding the Declaration of the Federation of Specialized Environmental Institutions and Companies

First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior and Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>:
*   Having reviewed Law No. (6) of 2010 regarding Labor in the Private Sector <orig>القطاع الأهلي</orig> and its amendments, and the administrative decisions in force.
*   And Decree-Law No. (109) of 2013 regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
*   And Decree No. (153) of 2022 regarding the supervision of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
*   And the founding documents deposited with the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
*   And based on the exigencies of work interest.
*** Has Decided ***
### Article One:
The Federation of Specialized Environmental Institutions and Companies <orig>اتحاد المؤسسات والشركات البيئية المختصة</orig> is hereby declared.
### Article Two:
This decision shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published along with a summary of the Articles of Association in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Issued on: 18 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 16 April 2025 AD

## Summary of the Articles of Association
### Federation of Specialized Environmental Institutions and Companies <orig>اتحاد المؤسسات والشركات البيئية المختصة</orig>
The Constituent General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية التأسيسية</orig> met on 2/5/2025, and the founders agreed to establish the Federation of Specialized Environmental Institutions and Companies <orig>اتحاد المؤسسات والشركات البيئية المختصة</orig>. Its Articles of Association stipulate the following:
*   Holders of licenses to practice environmental consulting, environmental services, and environmental activities that meet the conditions specified in Article 5 of these Articles, and who wish to join, shall be accepted into the Federation's membership by a decision of the Board of Directors.
*   The Federation's fiscal year begins from the start of January to the end of December of each year.
*   The Federation's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> shall convene during the first quarter following the end of the preceding year.
*   The Federation's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall consist of (5) members elected by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> by secret ballot for a term of (4) years.
*   The members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect from among themselves, at their first meeting, an executive body consisting of a Chairman, a Vice-Chairman, a Secretary, a Treasurer, and a Member.
*   The bylaws specify the powers of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig>, the powers of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and the registers maintained by the Federation.

## Decision No. (67) of 2025

Having reviewed Article (21) of Law No. (32) of 1968 regarding Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, and the Regulation of the Banking Profession, and its amendments.

# The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the extension of tender No. (D.A/129/2024-2025) for the license to exploit, manage, and operate an investment site at Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig> (Phase Three) - a local healthy restaurant kiosk (A6). Therefore, those wishing to participate, from companies or institutions specialized in this field, should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and tender documents during official working hours from (The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department). This is during official working hours, starting from the date of publication of the announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (150 K.D.) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (K-Net payment only) for the booklet. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempted from these fees (upon submission of the relevant certificate), from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:

1.  The last deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 1/5/2025. No bids will be accepted after this deadline.
2.  Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – at Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3.  Submission of a preliminary bond of not less than (2%) of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period, which is (90) days.
4.  Submission of a valid national labor percentage compliance certificate.
5.  A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the tender document.
6.  This tender is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7.  The bidder must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8.  The bid must remain valid for (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for the duration(s) it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.
9.  Companies must be registered with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> website).

https://pnsd.da.gov.kw/ar/
The tender is subject to Circular No. (1) of 2023 regarding tenders in public entities.
For inquiries:

or a letter of guarantee certified by one of the local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The submitted bond must be valid for 90 days from the date of opening the envelopes.
- Any bid not accompanied by the original preliminary bond, or if the bond value or duration is less than required, will be excluded.
- All companies participating in the practice are invited to attend the opening of envelopes at the time and place specified in the table above.
Notes:
1.  The following conditions apply to those submitting a bid for this practice:
    - Must be registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> as well as the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig>.
    - Submission of a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there are no suspensions on the company's files regarding government contracts registered with the Authority.
2.  All bid documents must be submitted on a (CD) or non-copyable electronic flash drives (3 copies), in addition to submitting hard copies of the bid format, price schedules, and the original preliminary bond.
3.  The tendering of practices and tenders by the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig> and any other works announced by the Ministry can be followed via the following link:
https://tenders.awqaf.gov.kw

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>

Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No.: P.M/S/2026/2025/7 for equipping 28 vehicles with sirens and warning lights – First Responder Project, according to the general and special conditions specified in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), for a non-refundable payment of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

Please note that the closing date for the practice is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 12/05/2025, at the bid box in the General Office of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> – Ministry of Health Building – First Floor – Procurement Department – Practices Section). Tender documents will be published on the Agency's website for review before proceeding to purchase the documents.
- The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for depositing bids.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on the CD available on the Agency's website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
- The aforementioned cash payment must be made by certified check or K-Net card.
- The last date for receiving inquiries and clarifications from companies is 12/05/2025, and no inquiries or clarifications received after this date will be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and initial security, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Not divisible.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as companies wishing to attend the bid opening session are entitled to do so.
- Companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department <orig>قسم فض العطاءات</orig> before the scheduled bid opening session and bring the following documents:
1. A copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig>.
2. A copy of the signature authorization for the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. In case of attendance by a person other than the authorized signatory, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> must be presented, authorizing the person deemed fit to attend the session.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempted from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article (39) of Law No. 74 of 2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to bid for the tender must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement
### Regarding the Offering of Auction No. 71 / 2024 – 2025

The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the offering of Auction No. 71 / 2024 – 2025 for the investment of sites within the Ministry of Information complex for the sale of beverages and food products of international specifications. This is in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the auction documents, which can be purchased via the Ministry of Information's website using the barcode attached to the announcement, starting from Sunday, 27/4/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (30 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>) thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only. Offers must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> – Ground Floor – Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> – Al-Soor Street <orig>شارع السور</orig>, inside sealed envelopes, accompanied by a preliminary bond <orig>تأمين أولي</orig> of no less than 2% and no more than 5% of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee <orig>خطاب ضمان</orig> issued by one of the local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, valid for the bid's validity period (90 days). The envelope must be sealed with red wax and the auction number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside, while avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any indication thereof. 4. # Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

### Announcement
A request has been submitted by the owners of Outfit Company <orig>شركة اوت فيت</orig> for Receiving and Delivering Clothes, which is under liquidation.
A request has been submitted to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out the dissolution and liquidation of the company.
Legal Entity: One-Person Company <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor, until a judicial ruling is issued on their objection.

### Announcement
A request has been submitted by the owners of Ajrat Al-Afnan Al-Jawwal Company <orig>أجرة الافنان الجوال</orig>.
A request has been submitted to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out:
Amendment of the legal entity from: One-Person Company <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد</orig> to the new legal entity: Limited Liability Company <orig>شركة ذات مسؤولية محدودة</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor, until a judicial ruling is issued on their objection.

### Announcement
A request has been submitted by the owners of Sabiq International Company for Project Management <orig>سابق الدولية لإدارة المشاريع</orig>, which is under liquidation.
A request has been submitted to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out: Dissolution and liquidation of the company.

# Al Ahli Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الأهلي الكويتي</orig> (K.S.C.P.)
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on Wednesday, 2025/4/16
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> of the shareholders of Al Ahli Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك الأهلي الكويتي</orig> (K.S.C.P.) held its annual meeting at 11:00 AM on Wednesday, 2025/4/16, on the fifteenth floor of the Bank's head office. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Talal Mohammed Reda Yousef Behbehani <orig>طلال محمد رضا يوسف بهبهاني</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors – and was attended by:

**First:**
a) By direct attendance: Shareholders representing – in person and by proxy – 1,608,060,776 shares, constituting 64.92% (direct attendance percentage) of the total shares of the Bank after excluding treasury shares.
b) By electronic attendance: Shareholders representing 643,774,023 shares, constituting 25.99% (electronic attendance percentage) of the total shares of the Bank after excluding treasury shares.
Thus, the total number of shares of shareholders present directly and electronically is: 2,251,834,799 shares, with a total voting percentage of 90.910% of the Bank's total issued and paid-up capital after excluding treasury shares.

**Second:**
Ms. Sheikha Adnan Al-Fulaij <orig>شيخة عدنان الفليح</orig> (from Al-Aiban & Al-Osaimi & Partners <orig>مكتب العيبان والعصيمي وشركاهم</orig> – a member of Ernst & Young), and Mr. Ali Bader Al-Wazzan <orig>علي بدر الوزان</orig> (from Deloitte & Touche – Al-Wazzan & Partners <orig>ديلويت وتوش – الوزان وشركاه</orig>), the Bank's auditors for the fiscal year ended 2024/12/31.

**Third:**
Mr. Khalid Abdullah Al-Omari <orig>خالد عبد الله العمري</orig>, representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.

**Fourth:**
Ms. Manal Jassim Al-Hamad <orig>منال جاسم الحمد</orig> – Representative of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The meeting secretariat was handled by Mr. Fawzi Thanyan Ali Al-Thanyan <orig>فوزي ثنيان علي الثنيان</orig> – Director General of Board Affairs (Board Secretary).
After Mr. Talal Mohammed Reda Yousef Behbehani <orig>طلال محمد رضا يوسف بهبهاني</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors (Chairman of the Assembly), announced the availability of the legal quorum for the Ordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the Assembly opened the meeting, welcoming the esteemed shareholders and thanking them for attending.
Thereafter, the Ordinary General Assembly proceeded to discuss the items on its agenda and issued the following resolutions regarding them:
Thereafter, the Extraordinary General Assembly proceeded to discuss the items on its agenda and issued the following resolutions regarding them:

1. Approval of increasing the Bank's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital from KWD 249,310,667.500 (Two Hundred Forty-Nine Million, Three Hundred Ten Thousand, Six Hundred Sixty-Seven Kuwaiti Dinars and 500 Fils) distributed over 2,493,106,675 shares, with a par value of 100 Fils per share, to KWD 261,776,200.800 (Two Hundred Sixty-One Million, Seven Hundred Seventy-Six Thousand, Two Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars and 800 Fils) distributed over 2,617,762,008 shares. The value of the increase is KWD 12,465,533.300 (only Twelve Million, Four Hundred Sixty-Five Thousand, Five Hundred Thirty-Three Kuwaiti Dinars and 300 Fils), representing 5% of the capital, by issuing 124,655,333 new shares to be distributed to shareholders registered in the Bank's records as free bonus shares at a rate of 5% (five shares for every one hundred shares), as detailed in the following timeline:
Free bonus shares at a rate of 5% (five percent) will be distributed to shareholders registered in the Bank's records as of the end of the entitlement date, which is Sunday, May 11, 2025. The distribution of bonus shares to the accounts of eligible shareholders will commence on Tuesday, May 13, 2025. The Board of Directors is authorized to amend the aforementioned timeline for implementing the General Assembly's resolution to distribute bonus shares if the registration procedures are not completed eight business days before the entitlement date or for any other reasons.
The value of this increase will be covered from the 2024 profits, and the Board of Directors is authorized to dispose of any fractional shares arising therefrom as it deems appropriate.
- This item was approved by direct vote by all shareholders present in person, with 100% of the direct attendance percentage, which was 64.92%.
- Regarding electronic voting, this item was approved by electronic vote by 24.158%, not approved by electronic vote by 0.000%, and abstained from voting on this item by electronic vote (without stating reasons) by 1.833%, all calculated from the total shares of the Bank's capital after excluding treasury shares.

## Salhia Real Estate Company (K.S.C.P.) <orig>شركة الصالحية العقارية (ش. م. ك. ع)</orig>
### Minutes of the Extra-ordinary General Assembly Meeting for the Fiscal Year Ended December 31, 2024
### Minutes of the Extra-ordinary General Assembly meeting of Salhia Real Estate Company K.S.C.P. for the Year Ended on 31/12/2024

The Extra-ordinary General Assembly of shareholders of Salhia Real Estate Company K.S.C.P. held its twenty-Seventh meeting for the fiscal year ending on December 31, 2024, at 11:30 AM on Thursday, April 17, 2025, at Courtyard Marriott Hotel – Hall 4 – Third Floor. The meeting was conducted both physically and electronically.

The Extra-ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> of shareholders of Salhia Real Estate Company K.S.C.P. <orig>شركة الصالحية العقارية ش. م. ك. ع</orig> for the fiscal year ending on 2024/12/31 was held at 11:30 AM on Thursday, 2025/04/17, at the Courtyard Marriott Hotel – Hall 4 – Third Floor, where the meeting was conducted both physically and electronically.

The meeting was chaired by Mr. Faisal Abdul Mohsen Al-Khatrash <orig>فيصل عبد المحسن الخترش</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, and attended by: –
- The company's auditor, Mr. Bader Adel Al-Abduljader <orig>بدر عادل العبد الجادر</orig> from Al-Aiban & Al-Osaimi & Partners Ernst & Young <orig>العيبان والعصيمي وشركاهم ارنست ويونغ</orig>.
- The representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>, Mr. Mohammed Bouhadi <orig>محمد بوهادي</orig>.
After the Chairman of the Assembly announced the completion of the legal quorum with the attendance of shareholders representing 72,412,301 shares out of 85,000,000 shares, i.e., 85.19%, the Chairman of the meeting opened the session, welcoming the esteemed attendees and thanking them for accepting the invitation to attend the meeting. Then, the Extra-ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> began discussing the agenda as follows:
1. Approval of the Board of Directors' recommendation to reduce the authorized, issued, and paid-up capital of the company from KWD 8,500,000 (eight million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 3,000,000 (three million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), by an amount of KWD 5,500,000 (five million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), which is equivalent to 64.7% of the company's capital, due to excess capital. The amount shall be returned to shareholders, each according to their proportion, provided that it is for shareholders registered in the company's records up to the date of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> meeting.

## Al-Ra'eda Projects Company – (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة الرائدة للمشاريع – (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig> (Closed)
### Under Liquidation - Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting held on 09/04/2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Al-Ra'eda Projects Company K.S.C.C. <orig>شركة الرائدة للمشاريع ش.م.ك</orig> (Closed) – Under Liquidation, was held on Wednesday, 09/04/2025, at 01:30 PM at the headquarters of Industrial and Financial Investments Company <orig>شركة الاستثمارات الصناعية والمالية</orig> – in Sharq <orig>الشرق</orig> area – Block 5 – Jaber Al-Mubarak Street <orig>شارع جابر المبارك</orig> – Commercial Real Estate Building <orig>بناية التجارية العقارية</orig> – Fourth Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Hussein Abdullah Jawhar <orig>حسين عبد الله جوهر</orig>, the company's liquidator, and attended by:
- Mr. Ahmed Hamdy Nabih Abdel Nabi <orig>أحمد حمدي نبيه عبد النبي</orig>, representative of Al-Waha Audit Office <orig>مكتب الواحة لتدقيق الحسابات</orig>
- After auditing and reviewing all documents related to the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting and the proxies of the attendees, both in person and by proxy, the Chairman of the session announced the completion of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly, as shareholders representing 10,000,000 shares, constituting (100%) of the capital amounting to K.D. 1,000,000, were present in person and by proxy.
- The Chairman of the session welcomed the attendees and requested to begin discussing the agenda items and voting on them as follows:
**First / Extension of Liquidation Period for One Year:**
- Mr. Hussein Abdullah Jawhar <orig>حسين عبد الله جوهر</orig> – Chairman of the session, explained the reasons for not completing the liquidation due to lawsuits filed against the company, and there is no possibility to estimate the time period that the procedures for ending these cases may take.
- Based on the foregoing, the attending shareholders unanimously approved by 100% the following:
1. Extension of the company's liquidation period for one year from the date of annotation in the Commercial Register.
2. Mandating the company's liquidator to complete the procedures with the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
**Second / Appointment of Mr. Hussein Abdullah Jawhar as Liquidator for the Company:**
- The attending shareholders unanimously approved by 100% the appointment of Mr. Hussein Abdullah Jawhar <orig>حسين عبد الله جوهر</orig> as liquidator for the company for one year.
**Third / Determination of Liquidator's Fees:**
- Mr. Hussein Abdullah Jawhar <orig>حسين عبد الله جوهر</orig> – Chairman of the session, proposed that the liquidation be without fees, and the attending shareholders unanimously approved by 100%

### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Al-Ghunaim Commercial Company Limited <orig>شركة الغنيم التجارية المحدودة</orig> (K.S.C.C.) (Closed) was held at 11:00 AM on Sunday, 20/4/2025, at the company's headquarters located in Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>الشويخ الصناعية</orig>, Plot 41-44.
