### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of the Company

On Wednesday, April 16, 2025, at 12:30 PM, at the company's headquarters located in Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> - Plot 5 - Ahmed Al-Jaber Street <orig>شارع أحمد الجابر</orig> - Baram Tower <orig>برج برام</orig> - 7th Floor / M, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Al-Sharqiya Educational Services Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشرقية للخدمات التعليمية (ش.م.ك.م.)</orig> was held. In attendance was the company's auditor, Mr. Taheri Bharmal <orig>طاهري بهارمال</orig> from PricewaterhouseCoopers Al-Shatti & Partners <orig>برايس ووتر هاوس كوبرز الشطي وشركاه</orig> (by proxy), with an attendance rate of 97.929% of the shareholders. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Othman Ayman Boudi <orig>عثمان أيمن بودي</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors of Al-Sharqiya Educational Services Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشرقية للخدمات التعليمية (ش.م.ك.م.)</orig>. The agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly was discussed, and the following was approved:

1.  Approval of the reduction of the company's issued capital from KWD 6,000,000 (Six Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 5,500,000 (Five Million Five Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), by an amount of KWD 500,000 (Five Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), due to the non-payment of the issued capital.

2.  Approval of the amendment of Article No. (6) of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article No. (5) of the Bylaws <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, as follows:

    -   **Text Before Amendment:**
        The company's authorized and issued capital is set at KWD 6,000,000 (Six Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed over 60,000,000 shares, with each share valued at 100 fils <orig>فلس</orig>, and all shares are cash shares.
        The company's paid-up capital is set at KWD 5,000,000 (Five Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed over 50,000,000 shares, with each share valued at 100 fils <orig>فلس</orig>, and all shares are cash shares.

    -   **Text After Amendment:**

3.  Approval of the amendment of Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article No. (4) of the Bylaws <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> "The Objects for which the Company was Established". This is as follows:

The cladding of the disputed property is "Al-Simja" <orig>السيمجا</orig>.
Mr. Expert of Knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> at the Administration took the necessary notes in preparation for estimating the property's value.
Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price of the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the sale session's conclusion.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any decrease in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of the enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Alert: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

4- Aisha Hamad Abdullah Al-Salal <orig>عائشه حمد عبدالله الصلال</orig>.
5- Latifa Hamad Abdullah Al-Salal <orig>لطيفه حمد عبدالله الصلال</orig>.
Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
Property Document No. 2022/11069 located in Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> area – Plot No. 66 – Block No. 3 – Plan M/36875, with an area of 600 m2, to be sold by public auction at a basic price of 405,000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (Four Hundred Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the description certificate:
- No violations.
** According to the expert's report:
Expert session dated 1/7/2023: We moved to the disputed property located in Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> area, Block 3, Street 9, House 21, Plot 66, Automated Number 12803986, in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff personally and her agent, and the first defendant personally and as an agent for the defendants from the second to the fifth, and in the presence of the expert of knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> assisted by the Administration, Mr. Tariq Al-Moajel <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, to estimate the value of the property and the value of the usufruct for the property from 9/7/2011. The inspection was as follows:
1. The property subject of the lawsuit is located on one street and a back alley, bordered by a neighbor on two sides, and has a small setback in the front facade, paved and partially shaded, used as parking spaces.
2. The property subject of the lawsuit is a government house <orig>بيت حكومي</orig> for private residence, with old finishes, its exterior cladding is limestone, and its area is (600) square meters according to the inheritance ownership document dated 6/11/2022, bearing number 11069, owned jointly by the plaintiff and the defendants from the first to the fifth, as stated in the aforementioned document.
3. The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a main building, two front annexes, and a back annex, according to the following details:
- The main building consists of a ground floor and a first floor, according to the following details:
* The ground floor consists of a living room, a reception hall, a bathroom, a kitchen, a maid's room, and its bathrooms.
* The first floor consists of four rooms, a hall, and two bathrooms.
- The first front annex consists of a room and a bathroom, and the other annex is a storage room.
- The back annex consists of two floors, ground and first, according to the following details:
The ground floor consists of a living room, a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a room, three bathrooms, a maid's room, and a kitchen.
The first floor is a room made of "Kirby" <orig>الكيربي</orig> (prefabricated material).
The disputed property has an old finishing level, and only the paints and flooring in the main building have been renovated according to the following details: the flooring is ceramic, the air conditioning is split units, the lighting is spotlights, the decorations are gypsum, and the walls have ordinary paint.
It was found that the back annex is separate from the main building, with a separate entrance from the back alley, which the plaintiff enabled us to enter as she possesses the keys to the annex, and it is completely abandoned.
The first defendant stated that the fifth defendant resides in the property and utilizes the main building and its attached front annex.
It was found that the disputed property is not leased and generates no income.
Mr. Expert of Knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> assisted by the Administration inspected the property, recorded his observations, and reviewed the inheritance ownership document for the disputed property, in preparation for estimating the property's value and the value of its usufruct.

Announcement of Property Sale by Public Auction
The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Monday, 19/5/2025 – Hall 48 – on the second floor of the Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل</orig> at 9:00 AM – in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2024/41 Sales/1 <orig>بيوع/1</orig>
Filed by:
Fahda Juma'an Al-Khailan Al-Enezi <orig>فهده جميعان الخيلان العنزي</orig>.
Against:
The heirs of the late Hamad Abdullah Al-Salal <orig>حمد عبدالله الصلال</orig>, namely:
1- Bader Hamad Abdullah Al-Salal <orig>بدر حمد عبدالله الصلال</orig>.
2- Hala Hamad Abdullah Al-Salal <orig>هاله حمد عبدالله الصلال</orig>.
3- Salwa Hamad Abdullah Al-Salal <orig>سلوى حمد عبدالله الصلال</orig>.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price specified for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be re-opened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session to reduce the purchase price with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be re-opened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be re-opened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session will be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in accordance with the law and is requested for bidders for the sale procedures, at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice:
- 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
- 2- The auction judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
- 3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the expropriated owner is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

** And according to what was stated in the Expert's Report:
- On 2024/4/16, the site of the dispute, located in Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area - Block (5) - Street (1) - Plot (17) House (28), was visited in the presence and with the guidance of the plaintiff personally. The remaining parties to the lawsuit or their representatives failed to attend. In the presence of Mr. Fallah Nasser Murshid <orig>فلاح ناصر مرشد</orig>, the expert of knowledge at the administration, the inspection was carried out as follows:
The property subject of the lawsuit conforms in terms of general specifications to the sale contract issued by the Real Estate Registration Department, registered under No. (1992/5739) and with an area of 910m2, submitted by the plaintiff's agent with their documents in the session on 2024/4/1, Document (1).
The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residential plot located on two streets (Street (1) and Street (102)), bordered by a neighbor on two sides, and has (4) entrances on Street (1) side and (3) entrances on Street (102) side.
The door and guard were knocked, and no one answered. Therefore, the expert of knowledge inspected the property subject of the lawsuit from the outside.
The property subject of the lawsuit is a residential plot consisting of two parts, detailed as follows:
The first part, with automated number (12770205), consists of a ground floor, first floor, and roof. The exterior cladding on Street (102) side is rough white limestone with pink accents, and the exterior cladding on Street (1) side is beige stone.

The air conditioning of the property subject of the lawsuit is central and split units.
The windows are aluminum, and there are shutters for the windows of the second part on Street (1) side.
There are parking spaces on Street (102) side.
The expert of knowledge inspected the property subject of the lawsuit in preparation for estimating the property's value (land and buildings and total value) and submitting the relevant report. He also reviewed the lawsuit file and its documents.

** According to the Expert's Report:
On 17/3/2021, the expert moved to the disputed property located in Sabah Al-Salem <orig>صباح السالم</orig> area – Block 13 – First Street, Plot 41, and inspected it on site in the presence and guidance of the appellant personally, the first respondent personally, and the agent of the second and third respondents, with the assistance of Mr. Study Expert at the Department / Tariq Abdullah Al-Moajel <orig>طارق عبد الله المعجل</orig>. 1- The disputed property is a private residence with front and back access, and a side opening to an electrical transformer. It is bordered by neighbors on one side and has side and rear setbacks. It is a government-issued property with an area of 300.125 m2, renovated from an old statement, and fully clad with white stone from the outside.
2- The building has a relatively modern statement, with an ivory and gray Sigma facade, and has parking spaces in front of it, and two entrances from the inside.
3- The expert knocked on the door, and one of the residents opened it and stated that the first defendant does not reside in the property and that it is leased to others.
4- The expert inspected the property from the outside and found numbered doors on the apartments.

It also became clear that one of the basements is residential and the other is for car parking.
6- The disputed property consists of a ground floor and a first floor, with nothing on the roof, with the following details:
  a- The ground floor consists of 4 rooms + 4 bathrooms + a hall + a kitchen + a storage room.
  b- The first floor consists of 5 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a large hall + a large kitchen.
7- The exterior cladding is white stone.
8- The house's air conditioning consists of separate units.
9- Ceramic floors and no elevator.
10- The Study Expert took the necessary observations from the outside in preparation for estimating the value of the property (land and building) and the value of the quarter from the outside.
11- The expert took photographs of the disputed property.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the basic price <orig>الثمن الأساسي</orig> associated with the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense <orig>على ذمته</orig> in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase calculated on the full auction price; in this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense <orig>على ذمته</orig> based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder <orig>المزايد المتخلف</orig> shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price of KWD 4,720,000 (four million seven hundred twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
First: The auction starts with a base price of K.D. 1,782,000 (one million seven hundred eighty-two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and claimants for sale procedures are responsible for their actions without any liability on the part of the Court Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig>.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.

In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and property registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, at least one-fifth of the price must be deposited, and the bidding shall be resumed at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder whose offer was approved deposits at least one-fifth of the price, the sale shall be postponed with a ten percent increase.
Fifth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price.

Secondly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be re-opened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding will be re-opened in the same session based on the price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately re-opened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session, and no offer in this session not accompanied by a deposit of its full value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, the expenses of execution procedures amounting to 200 KWD, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall be responsible for them, without the Registry Department <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedures <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of pronouncement of the judgment in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedures <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedures <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in his favor at a fair market rent."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

### Announcement
Practice No. (MEW / 6 / 2021-2022)
Civil Works for the Establishment, Completion, and Maintenance of the Electricity Emergency Center in Khaitan <orig>خيطان</orig> Area.
The Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces the offering of the aforementioned practice. Practice documents can be obtained from the Contracts and Tenders Department (Tenders Control) in the main building of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> (South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>) - Sixth Ring Road, First Floor, according to the following data:
- Offering Date: 4 / 5 / 2025.
- Closing Date: 2 / 6 / 2025.
- Document Price: (50) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (Fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
- Initial Security Deposit: (10,000) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (Ten Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) valid for (90) days in favor of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>.
- This practice: General
- This practice: Non-divisible.

Announcement of Tender No. PACI-1-2025/2026
Regarding the investment of a food sales and services site at the Authority's main headquarters
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces the publication of a simple tender in a sealed envelope regarding the investment of a food sales and services site at the Authority's main headquarters, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the booklet:
1- These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department - Cashier Section (South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> - Ministries Area - Ground Floor) during official working hours for a fee of K.D. 50/- (Fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
2- The deadline for submitting bids to the Financial Affairs Department is 12:00 PM on Thursday, 8/5/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
3- The preliminary meeting will be held at 12:00 PM on Sunday, 4/5/2025, for companies wishing to participate in the tender at the Authority's main headquarters in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> / Multi-purpose Hall on the Ground Floor.
4- The amount of the preliminary guarantee must not be less than 2% (two percent) of the tender bid value and must be a certified check or a guarantee issued by one of the approved local banks in Arabic and valid throughout the bid validity period.
5- The final guarantee amount is 10% (ten percent) of the total value, provided that this guarantee is issued by one of the approved local banks in Arabic.

Brothers wishing to purchase must attend the auction site on the specified date, observing the following terms of sale:
1. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may sell the goods in one lot or several lots, depending on the sale conditions.
2. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear a brokerage commission <orig>عمولة دلالة</orig> of 2% of the sale price.
3. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> must pay the value of the goods only via K-net <orig>الكي-نت</orig>, as determined by the Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig>.
4. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> must remove the goods from the Bait Al-Mal Control Department <orig>مراقبة بيت المال</orig> premises urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. If the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
6. The administration has the right to stop, postpone, or re-schedule the sale at another time if a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interest.
7. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
8. Since the goods will be sold as-is, bidders must inspect them to ascertain their condition, quality, and type at the address mentioned above during the auction sale.
9. In the event that the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> refrains from paying the sale price or part thereof, the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> has the right to re-sell on their account. If the price does not reach the amount for which the auction was initially awarded, they are obligated to pay the difference. In this case, the administration has the right to bar them from participating in any future auctions.
10. The administration is not responsible for any action or use of the sold goods that violates the prevailing laws and legislations.
11. This sale is conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 10 of 2003 regarding the Unified Customs System <orig>القانون رقم 10 لسنة 2003 بشأن النظام الموحد للجمارك</orig> and its regulating decisions.
12. All bidders must adhere to health and preventive requirements.

# Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
## Announcement No. 46/2025

The holder of the following license has submitted a request to the Municipality:
<table_caption>License Holder Information</table_caption>
<table>
| Commercial Name | Al-Dahi International General Trading and Construction Contracting Company <orig>شركة الضاحي الدولي للتجارة العامة والمقاولات الإنشائية</orig> |
|:---|:---|
| Category | Municipality Contractor, Category D |
| Registration No. | 7200268 |
</table>
requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in consideration of its classification.

Based on Article (19) of Municipality Decision No. (161/2009) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation may issue its decision thereon after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- Fifteen days have passed from the date of publication of this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

The cancellation of the license or registration entails the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this decision.

Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Section in the Engineering Systems Department within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

## Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>
Announcement of Company Registration

The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> announces the commencement of receiving applications from companies wishing to register as approved suppliers with the Authority, in addition to updating the data of companies already registered in its suppliers' register for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
Please note that all purchasing operations will be conducted through the Authority's external website.

### Required Activities:
*   Stationery and office supplies – Computer hardware and accessories – Office equipment – Electronic and technical devices – Publications – Advertising and publicity – Hospitality and gift presentation – Furniture and furnishings – Agriculture – Translation offices – Auditing offices – Firefighting equipment – Cooling spare parts – Blacksmithing and carpentry works – Transportation services – Car rental – Hotels – Insurance services – Food supplies and hotel necessities – Training services – Exhibitions (communication and networks).

### Required Documents for Registration or Update:
*   Commercial license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
*   Certificate of incorporation and license from the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
*   Commercial name and number.
*   Certificate from the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> (Civil ID Number).
*   Phone numbers.
*   Address.
*   Nature of activity.
*   Bank account number in IBAN format.
*   Contact details (email).

### Method of Application:
*   Payment of due fees for registration and update at the Revenue and Collection Department <orig>إدارة الإيرادات والتحصيل</orig> – Revenue and Cashier Section <orig>قسم الإيرادات والصندوق</orig> for an amount of K.D. 20.000 (twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig>).
*   Applications are submitted at the Authority's main building in the Ministries Area <orig>منطقة الوزارات</orig> – First Floor – Procurement Department <orig>قسم المشتريات</orig> from 01/05/2025 until 31/12/2025, from 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM.
*   For review and inquiries, please contact phone number 25301072.
*   Or by correspondence via email purchases@pahw.gov.kw.

Announcement
Announcement of Practice No. (BZM 2025/13)
Renewal of PaloAlto Protection Device Licenses for Zakat House <orig>بيت الزكاة</orig>
Zakat House <orig>بيت الزكاة</orig> announces the offering of a practice for the renewal of PaloAlto protection device licenses for Zakat House <orig>بيت الزكاة</orig>. Specialized companies in this field wishing to apply for the practice documents should visit Zakat House <orig>بيت الزكاة</orig> - Ground Floor - Treasury Department <orig>قسم الخزينة</orig> - during official working hours to receive the practice terms and documents for a fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (non-refundable).
Please note that the deadline for receiving bids will be at 1:00 PM (13:00) on Monday, 2025/5/19, at the main Zakat House <orig>بيت الزكاة</orig> located in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> - Ministries Area <orig>منطقة الوزارات</orig> - Third Floor - Bids Box <orig>صندوق العطاءات</orig>.
The bid opening will be on the same closing day at 2:00 PM (14:00) on the Ground Floor - Theater.
Companies wishing to attend the bid opening meeting must send an email to PTS@zakathouse.org.kw one day before the bid opening, attaching (a letter from the company confirming the attendance of its representative - a copy of the civil ID). Please note that only one person from each company applying for the practice is allowed, and companies that do not comply will not be permitted to enter the bid opening meeting.
